action.action-desc: Mr. Chaffetz introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to provide incentives for the development of new combination drugs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Combination Drug Development Incentive Act of 2015 .

section.header: Applicability to combination drugs submitted under a new drug application

subsection.text: Clause (ii) of section 505(c)(3)(E) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355(c)(3)(E)(ii)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (ii) If an application submitted under subsection (b) for a drug, no active ingredient (including any ester or salt of the active ingredient) of which has been approved in any other application under subsection (b), and inserting (ii)(I) If an application submitted under subsection (b) for a drug, and described in subclause (II) or (III),; and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: An application is described in this subclause if no active ingredient (including any ester or salt of the active ingredient) of the drug for which the application has been submitted has been approved in any other application under subsection (b).
An application is described in this subclause if—

item.text: the application contains reports of new clinical investigations (other than bioavailability studies) essential to the approval of the application and conducted or sponsored by the applicant;
the application is for a drug which contains a combination of active ingredients; and
no such combination of active ingredients has been approved in any other application under subsection (b).

subsection.text: Subclause (I) of section 505(c)(3)(E)(ii) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, as designated by subsection (a)(1), is amended by striking is approved after the date of the enactment of this clause and inserting is approved after January 1, 2016, in the case of an application described in subclause (II) or subclause (III).
Clause (iii) of section 505(c)(3)(E) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355(c)(3)(E)) is amended by striking If and inserting Except as provided in clause (ii), if.
